itemLabel: John Charles Harding, 2nd Baron Harding of Petherton

wikipedia_page.main:
John Charles Harding, 2nd Baron Harding of Petherton (12 February 1928 – 6 June 2016) was a British Army officer and hereditary peer.
Harding was educated at Marlborough College and Worcester College, Oxford (MA). He was commissioned into the British Army and served with the 11th Hussars, reaching the rank of major. He succeeded his father John Harding, 1st Baron Harding of Petherton to the title of Baron Harding of Petherton in 1989.
By his wife, Harriet, daughter of Major General Francis Hare (whom he married in 1966), he had two sons and one daughter. Harriet died on 4 December 2012. His daughter, Dido Harding, Baroness Harding of Winscombe, is married to Conservative MP John Penrose. Harding died in June 2016 at the age of 88.

response: *John Charles Harding, 2nd Baron Harding of Petherton (1928–2016), British army officer

link_mentions.page: John Harding, 1st Baron Harding of Petherton
response: In 1927 he married Mary Rooke; they had one son: John Charles Harding, 2nd Baron Harding of Petherton.

Harding is the daughter of John Charles Harding, 2nd Baron Harding of Petherton, and the granddaughter of Field Marshal John Harding, 1st Baron Harding of Petherton, who commanded the Desert Rats for a few months in World War II.
**John Charles Harding, 2nd Baron Harding of Petherton, 88, army officer and peer.
